topic: How to package notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to package notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Packaging Notebooks for Production Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to transform Jupyter Notebooks into production-ready applications using FastAPI and Python 3.12+. The process includes converting the notebook to a Python script, setting up a virtual environment, installing required dependencies, writing an entry point, and deploying the application.
key_points: Convert Jupyter Notebook to Python script using nbconvert
Set up a virtual environment with python3.12
Install FastAPI, Uvicorn (ASGI server), and other dependencies
Write an entry point (main.py) that includes the FastAPI app and notebook functions
Modify notebook cells to call the corresponding functions in main.py
Deploy the application on a suitable platform like Heroku

code_examples.code:
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
normally install dependencies (FastAPI, Uvicorn, etc.)

from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
def function_from_notebook():
    # notebook code here

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for the examples to run
FastAPI version 0.75.0 and Uvicorn version 0.17.6 are used in these examples
caveats: The process involves manual modifications to the notebook, so be sure to back up your work beforehand
It's essential to adapt the code examples according to your specific project requirements
